dataobject¶

Contains the class DataObject and static methods with DataObjects as parameters and possible auxiliary functions.

DataObject¶

class DataObject¶

The DataObject class contains the data of the objects, that are plotted.

property is_vertex: bool¶
DataObject.__init__(self, data)¶

Builds the GUI with event binding and empty plots. Return value is None.

Parameters:

  • self (DataObject) – non-static method

  • data (list[list[list[float]]]) – data is a list of object data. Object data is ether a one-element list with a list of floats (modelling a 3D point) or a list of segment lists, each containing two lists with floats (modelling a line in 3D space).

Returns:

New DataObject, which contains the information of the input data and resulting properties.

Return type:

DataObject

get_plot_data_object(self, color) → dict¶
static square_distance_between[DataObject, DataObject](object_a, object_b)¶
